title: Make "show results as list" the default when searching
content: Hello, It would be great to have the possibility, at least, to choose this as a default result, not the actual one where you have to click "Show result as list". Thank you in advance
creator: Patricej

title: Problems with latest update of Thunderbird
content: I have been using Thunderbird for years. I loved it and there was never a problem. Until I updated to the latest version. My Operating system is Windows 10. The problem: It was impossible to set the size of the letters in a satisfying way. Only massive letters in writing emails resulted in a readable format on the receiving end. I tried one of the suggestions I found on the internet. Something like "set the same format initially and then again in Latin and the bottom choice of letter types". It did not work for me. So I decided to quit Thunderbird and start working with Gmail. Which is okay, but you have to be online and you have to change websites if you use more than one email address. I don't expect you to have a solution, but I want to inform you that I decided to quit after a years long good experience. Thank you for all your work and effort, Daniel van Schooneveld
creator: dvanschooneveld44

title: thunderbird completely slowed down the PC
content: Hi, I have had TB working for a decade without a (serious) problem, now it suddenly stopped working and slowed down creating a lot of problem to the whole PC. It wasn't useful to reinstall or moving mail from the inbox or rebuild the index, so now I've decided to purge it all and uninstalled it, then I need to know exactly all the remaining folder and file to delete, as well as registry keys involved by any modification. Other info: Win 10 pro 22H2 completely updated, no particular AV, rather firewall on the router plus Defender on the PC (intel 7 9gen + 16GB ram). I have 4 gmail accounts, 1 Italian free mail and 1 registered mail, that works very well from the relevant web sites. Just for the sake of curiosity, what kind of problem it could be? Most important of all: does such problem can repeat starting from scratch? I don't want to face again such kind of mess. Thank you for your time and consideration Best regards Vincenzo
creator: 62marvin

title: Thunderbird Calendar Not Sending Out Invitations to Other Addresses
content:
I am using Thunderbird 115.2.3 (32-bit) although this problem began yesterday before I updated to this latest version (which I hoped would fix the issue but it didn't). My operating system is Windows 10 Pro on which I just verified that I have all of its updates.

Supernova has been great until now. Beginning suddenly yesterday and without any setting changes on my part, the Calendar would no longer send out invitations to any other email addresses. The overall behavior is extremely odd.

First, upon entering individual addresses, notice how not only does that address now repeat itself (the two Gmail addresses which are my personal account there) but also that blank lines are inserted below. It never did that before yesterday.

Then, upon sending the invitation, shown in my Sent folder is a very odd "Accepted" message instead of the usual copy of the invitation. Because of what happens next, let me again stress that this shows up almost immediately in my Sent folder.

A few moments later, I receive an "Accepted" message in my Inbox that is an exact duplicate of what previously showed up in Sent. However, I never took such action nor did the invitation ever show up in either my Gmail or, in the case of the second screenshot, my Zoho account which I added to be certain that this wasn't just some weirdness being caused by Google.

I will be glad to provide any other information that might help diagnose this issue.
creator: kohoso

title: I cannot get my profile from my C drive on my old computer onto the new computer
content:
I have tried:

following all the steps on your support article https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

It doesn't really apply to me, because the former computer hardware does not work. I CANNOT boot up and go into the thunderbird program on that computer. Fortunately the drives were not damaged, and i can access my entire thunderbird profile, the roaming and the local.

I tried pasting the profile in the exact destination folder of the new thunderbird download. It then popped up this window. So i then uninstalled it and found the 90.1 version and installed that to see if the older version would talk to my older profile. this window popped up again. It keeps creating a NEW profile, but what i want Thunderbird to do is to pull up the old version because it has all of my message filters, and more importantly over 600 email contacts that I don't have a recent back up of since 06/2022. Thats approximately when i started my business so it has all my new bussiness contacts since then. If you can't get the profile to talk. can you direct me to:

where the "address book" DATA is stored in the thunderbird profile. If it lets me attach 3 images, ill also attach the images of what my thunderbird roaming and thunderbird local profile look like from my c drive.

I've found these 2 articles https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/using-multiple-profiles & https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/unable-launch-older-version-profile so I'll see if that can get my older profile going with the address book. I do notice that Thunderbird DOES use the TAGS i created, so is it possible that the PROFILE just doesn't included the address book at all? Either way, I need help getting that address book data, Profile working or not.

title: icloud.com account folders not available in ThunderBird 102.15.1
content: Through several iterations of upgrades to TB 64-bit on Windows Pro 64-bit, after setting up Microsoft and Gmail client accounts successfully, when I have proceeded to add my only iCloud account (@iCloud.com / @me.com) I have found that none of the existing iCloud.com email folders are presented in TB. Recently, without any TB upgrade, the number of email folders presented has spontaneously reduced further. Logging in to iCloud.com email online reveals both the original folders and the extra ones I have had to create via TB to be able to save messages, so communication from TB back to iCloud.com is clearly working, but the full list of folders in my iCloud account is not being reflected back to TB. Can anyone help me with this? I didn't have any problem in this way using MS Outlook as an email client; only in TB. Furthermore, this problem has not occurred with any of my other MS or Gmail domain email accounts. I wonder if this is a protocol or port discrepancy of some kind? If so, it's really not apparent. TIA, SamSun

title: lost files during migration
content:
Hi,

I've got a sticky problem which occurred when using Migration Assistant to move data from my Mac Pro Mid-2012 desktop (OS 10.13.6) to my recently bought used Mac Pro Destktop 2019 *(Ventura 13.5.2). After 6 hours or so of transference, it seemed to hang at ("About 5 minutes remaining...") so I quit, not noticing any warnings about not doing that or else.

What happened was I seemed to have lost Thunderbird Mail files (Ver. 102.15.1 64-bit) from the Mid-2012 MP and there were none showing in the target Mid-2012.

So I'm wondering if the files are truly lost or hidden/recoverable somewhere? I made a Time Machine back up in the Mid-2012 shortly before I did this, but don't know how to move just the Thunderbird files to the Mid-2012 safely.

Anyone had the same problem or have any clues as to how to resolve this?

Kind thanks in advance,

T

title: Hotmail (Outlook365) Credentials pop-up
content:
Right then, about a week ago Thunderbird updated from 115.2.2 to 115.2.3.

I use TB to manage my Gmail, Hotmail and business emails. Has worked well, until this new update.

I began immediately receiving a pop-up regarding my Hotmail account. Sometimes the pop-up flashes for a few seconds, other times it stays on the screen.

https://login.microsoftonline.com/common/oauth2/v2.0/authorize?response_type=code&client_id=9e5f94bc-e8a4-4e73-b8be-63364c29d753&redirect_uri=https%3A%2F%2Flocalhost&scope=https%3A%2F%2Foutlook.office365.com%2FIMAP.AccessAsUser.All+https%3A%2F%2Foutlook.office365.com%2FPOP.AccessAsUser.All+https%3A%2F%2Foutlook.office365.com%2FSMTP.Send+offline_access&login_hint=XXXX%40hotmail.com

  • The XXXX is my email name removed.

The pop-up is mostly blank except for a text box at the very top with a long string of characters. Above that it states, 'Enter credentials for XXXX@hotmail.com at Outlook.Office365.com'. I can't figure out if it wants me to enter the string of characters somewhere on Outlook or if I am supposed to copy something from Outlook and paste it into the text box. Moreover, I cannot seem to find anything online to assist.

The problem is emails from Outlook are not downloading to TB. My last downloaded email was on 11.09.23 and there are new messages in my Outlook.

Ideas?
creator: HondoMan

title: Error on Trying to Send
content:
Thunderbird 115.2.3 installed itself yesterday (2023-09-21) morning. I have two email accounts which I regularly use, on different server-pairs. On one, SMTP and IMAP is fine. On the other, a commercial provider, IMAP is fine but I get a pop-up window "Send message error <NL> Sending of the message failed" without any hint as to what failed.

SMTP Server settings are correctly listed by TBird: Server-DNS (checked many times; it is unique to the MX domain on which there are three accounts, of the form <MX-name with hyphens instead of dots>.<ISP-name with hyphens instead of dots>.de ), Port 587, STARTTLS, "normal password" authentication. I checked the password; TBird tells me it is what I thought it is; I can use it to log in to my MailSP's WWW Interface and send messages (through Port 25). Port 587 and STARTTLS are also correct; a colleague also with an account managed to send me a mail using same server, port, STARTTLS and his password.

So the chance that this is a TBird configuration error seems to me high. But no hint is given and I can't find anything that is wrong. Besides, it all worked the day before, before 115.2.2 was installed - when the problem arose, and continued with 115.2.3; these settings were taken over from the previous version on the update. The very same SW TBird 115.2.3 functions with the other Email server-pair without any problem.

thanks :)

title: Update changed IMAP to POP, using Earthlink
content:
After the update to Thunderbird 115.2.3, Thunderbird downloaded and deleted messages I had left on the server. I use Earthlink as my email server. I should have realized what happened when I suddenly had over 2500 sets of duplicate emails.

It appears that my Thunderbird is now set up for POP, although it had been IMAP for years. This is the second (or third) time his has happened in the last 6 months.

Three questions: 1) Can I change back to IMAP from POP without losing more 2) Is there a way to restore any of these emails to the server? 3) How can I prevent this in the future; once I update and restart, it is too late to prevent something like this as the damage is done.

Thank you.
creator: msprinker
